intro: Ganymedes albus, commonly known as the white ganymede, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its delicate, white flowers and fern-like foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are aromatic and have been historically used in herbal medicine for their purported health benefits. Ganymedes albus is also valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators.
